intro: Aquilegia stellata, commonly known as the star flower, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ranunculaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, including parts of Kazakhstan and Mongolia. The plant features showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or red, with a distinctive spurred shape on the back of each petal. Its leaves are compound, consisting of several small, oval-shaped leaflets arranged in a palmate pattern. Aquilegia stellata thrives in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade, making it a popular choice for alpine gardens.
